update.description:
I'm moving `ign-launch` to be part of `ign-tools`. The first step is to upgrade ign-tools to ign-cmake2. This PR removes the `cmake` directory and updates the main `CMakeLists.txt` file.

This PR requires #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-cmake/pull-requests/140
update.title: Updating to use ignition cmake 2

content.raw: based on the previous discussion, I don't think we need to bump the major version, but we should at least bump the minor to `0.2`
content.html: based on the previous discussion, I don't think we need to bump the major version, but we should at least bump the minor to 0.2

content.raw: Yeah, I guess the only problem is if you're building `ign-tools` from source from the `default` branch on xenial, but I don't know of anyone doing that. I guess this is ok. Thanks for your patience in talking me through it.
content.html: Yeah, I guess the only problem is if you're building ign-tools from source from the default branch on xenial, but I don't know of anyone doing that. I guess this is ok. Thanks for your patience in talking me through it.

content.raw:
The set of packages which use ign-tools consists of `ign-fuel-tools`, `ign-gui`, `ign-transport`, `ign-msgs`, and `sdformat`.

* `ign-fuel-tools`: Version 2, already released, is the last major version with xenial support.
* `ign-gui`: Has not been released
* `ign-transport`: Version 5, already released, is the last major version with xenial support
* `ign-msgs`: Version 2, already released, is the last major version with xenial support.
* `sdformat`: Version 6 was shipped without ign-tools as a dependency, and I don't see a reason to change that for version 7. Version 7 will also be the last major version with Xenial support.

I think `ign-gui` and `sdformat` are in the clear, which leaves `fuel-tools`, `transport`, and `msgs`.

If you're on xenial, you'll get the released xenial version of `ign-tools` (0.1.0). If you're on bionic then you'd get the (soon to be released) bionic version of `ign-tools` which could be 0.2.0 or 1.0.0. This will also work with other existing bionic packages.

I believe everything should work if your building from source, or doing a combination of source and binary install.

Is there another aspect to consider?
content.html:
The set of packages which use ign-tools consists of ign-fuel-tools, ign-gui, ign-transport, ign-msgs, and sdformat.

  • ign-fuel-tools: Version 2, already released, is the last major version with xenial support.
  • ign-gui: Has not been released
  • ign-transport: Version 5, already released, is the last major version with xenial support
  • ign-msgs: Version 2, already released, is the last major version with xenial support.
  • sdformat: Version 6 was shipped without ign-tools as a dependency, and I don't see a reason to change that for version 7. Version 7 will also be the last major version with Xenial support.

I think ign-gui and sdformat are in the clear, which leaves fuel-tools, transport, and msgs.

If you're on xenial, you'll get the released xenial version of ign-tools (0.1.0). If you're on bionic then you'd get the (soon to be released) bionic version of ign-tools which could be 0.2.0 or 1.0.0. This will also work with other existing bionic packages.

I believe everything should work if your building from source, or doing a combination of source and binary install.

Is there another aspect to consider?

content.raw:
we've already released this package, and it's a dependency for other ignition packages

I don't really care so much about the major version; I'm just concerned about not breaking those existing packages
content.html:
we've already released this package, and it's a dependency for other ignition packages

I don't really care so much about the major version; I'm just concerned about not breaking those existing packages

content.raw: It was my understanding that big changes are allowed when the major version is 0. Is that policy something we want to change?
content.html: It was my understanding that big changes are allowed when the major version is 0. Is that policy something we want to change?

content.raw:
adding a dependency and requiring bionic is a big change, so I think we should bump the major version to 1

it looks like you had some direct commits to `default` today, so I made an `ign-tools0` branch off of b93893e from last November
content.html:
adding a dependency and requiring bionic is a big change, so I think we should bump the major version to 1

it looks like you had some direct commits to default today, so I made an ign-tools0 branch off of b93893e from last November
